title: Malaysian PM Ibrahim, like several of us in India, is a 'big fan' of MGR: PM Modi

content: The Union Minister of State for railways and food processing industries also lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP leaders for standing by him

content: Majji Srinivasa Rao said that TDP had misled the people before the general elections with regard to Land Titling Act though it was done on the suggestion of the Central government

title: Government to constitute high-level panel on banking soon: Finance Minister
content: The Budget proposed to restructure the Power Finance Corporation and Rural Electrification Corporation to achieve scale and improve efficiency in the public sector NBFCs, as a first step.

title: Congress slams Assam BJP's 'point-blank shot' video for targeting minorities, asks judiciary to act
content: The now-deleted video showed Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma purportedly taking aim with a rifle and firing a shot at two people ‚Äî one wearing a skull cap and the other with a beard, with "point-blank shot" as the caption

title: NLC India signs MoU with Cuddalore district administration for infrastructure projects
content: Under the agreement, NLCIL will provide ‚Çπ20 crore for development of essential infrastructural facilities and improving skills across identified sectors.

title: Chidambaram Natyanjali festival to begin on February 13
content: On Maha Shivaratri (February 15), the programme would begin at 6 p.m. and go on till 1.35 a.m. the next day.

title: Punjab government suspends 2 IAS officers
content: Although the reasons for their suspension were not specified in the orders, sources said that it stemmed from a six-year delay in procuring smartphones for Anganwadi workers under the Union Government's Mission Saksham Anganwadi

title: Puducherry government issues advisory after avian influenza detection in Chennai crow samples
content: According to an official, surveillance has been intensified in wetlands, poultry farms, and live bird markets in Puducherry. Residents urged not to handle sick or dead birds.

title: AIMSA urges PM Modi to ensure safety, justice for medical students after Russia stabbing attack
content: At least six people, including four Indian students, were injured on Saturday (February 7, 2026) in a stabbing attack at a university in Russia‚Äôs Bashkortostan Republic

content: On January 19, the Delhi High Court had refused to suspend Sengar's 10-year jail term in the case on the grounds of delay in trial, saying it was partly caused by the multiple applications he had filed in the matter

content: In a statement, the police also said that the security forces recovered a mortar and two IEDs from the Yangoubung area along the Indo-Myanmar Border in Tengnoupal district on February 7

title: Army Chief reviews counter-terror ops in Jammu and Kashmir, deliberates on infusion of advanced tech
content: The Chief of Army staff attended a high-level security review meeting chaired by Home Minister Amit Shah and visited White Knight Headquarters in Jammu

title: Shivamogga police open fire, arrest rowdy-sheeter and his associates near Bhadravathi
content: Mubarak alias Dicchi, the rowdy-sheeter, suffered a gunshot wound on his right leg. He has been facing several charges including murder, attempted murder and extortion.

content: Mr. Stalin said he was constrained to write the letter in the light of some ‚Äúfactually incorrect information‚Äù being spread in the media in this regard

title: 16th Finance Commission identifies Tamil Nadu as one of top three States suffering¬†heavy¬†losses of public sector enterprises
content: For the year 2022-23, the top three States in this category were Uttar Pradesh (‚Çπ32,430 crore), Rajasthan (‚Çπ18,814 crore), and Tamil Nadu (‚Çπ16,048 crore), according to volume 1 of the commission‚Äôs report

title: Moolamppilly package: revenue officials dismiss need for monthly meetings
content: Revenue officials say there was no decision to hold monthly meetings of the MPMC. Evictee groups, however, point to earlier meeting minutes and court directions while flagging delays in rehabilitation and compensation.

title: T.N. government would like to take Home Again programmes for mentally ill to all districts: Chief Secretary
content: Mr. Muruganandam said the government was ensuring that residents of all homes for the mentally ill were being provided with services such as Aadhaar cards, pensions, ration cards, and priority was being given to them for housing and skill training

title: Penalties, warnings fail to curb wrong-side driving on city roads
content: Police should conduct a special drive, raise awareness to prevent such violations, say residents; traffic police official says they have identified 230 spots where people are prone to drive on wrong side, and have installed cameras to issue challans

title: ‚ÄòHumiliating‚Äô: Allahabad High Court sets aside placard punishment handed to Noida varsity student
content: A single-Judge Bench mandated the student to stand at the campus gate for 30 days carrying a placard declaring, ‚ÄúI will never misbehave with any girl‚Äù

title: Mysterious gas leak causes panic in Jammu; probe launched to identify nature of substance
content: Several residents of Rani Bagh complained of breathlessness following the sudden leakage of gas from an abandoned cylinder lying at the scrap dealer‚Äôs premises, say officials

content: Mostari Banu, who hails from Bhagwangola in Murshidabad and is associated with the CPI(M), said it was in response to her petition that the Supreme Court issued directions on January 19 to the ECI

content: It was proposed to introduce the¬†Bill during the last Winter session in Belagavi, but it was not done so; meanwhile, a Government Order on the one-day menstrual leave per month has been questioned in the Karnataka High Court

title: Zaman S. Khan wins Kochi round of The Hindu BusinessLine Cerebration Corporate Quiz 2026
content: Khan will now represent Kochi at the grand finale scheduled to be held at the BSE, Mumbai, on February 21

title: Police Inspector killed, 13 injured after swing collapses at Surajkund Mela in Faridabad
content: Haryana Tourism Minister Arvind Sharma, who visited the accident spot, said that directions were issued for a thorough investigation of the entire incident and assured strict action against the culprits

title: Forgetting Hindu sentiments led to Partition: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: ‚ÄúWe said we respect all religions because we are Hindus. There are people who say this was wrong. Islam and Christianity still exist in India. There are skirmishes, but the country has remained united,‚Äù says Bhagwat

content: Pointing to the ‚Äúcancer culture‚Äù of social media, she highlighted how PR-driven narratives influenced perspectives

content: Tamil Nadu has been ranked number one in the Centre‚Äôs ratings under DMK rule; despite this, the BJP-led Union govt. has not offered the poll-bound State any benefits in the Budget, the Chief Minister says

title: Two dead among 15 pulled out of debris as three-storey building collapses in Rajasthan's Kota
content: "In total, 15 people were taken out of the debris. While two have died, some of the injured were discharged after treatment. A probe will be ordered to ascertain the facts, and action will follow,‚Äù says Cabinet Minister

title: SIR woes continue on the last day of hearing in West Bengal
content: The Trinamool Congress highlights the plight of people, including incidents such as death of two people on the way to the hearing centre. The BJP alleges ‚Äòhooliganism‚Äô by the ruling party at the hearing centres.

title: People raised in State-run orphanages and charity homes struggle with SIR rules on parent mapping
content: ECI officials have said orphanage‚Äôs name should be entered in the column for parents, but lack of specific guidelines leads to chaos on the ground; with no lineage proof, State must provide needed documentation

content: Madhav suggests that polls in each of the five corporations will be held under a ‚Äòprabhari‚Äô from the party, to ensure accountability

content: We can decide only when official communication comes to us. So far, we have not received any communication, says a BMRCL official

title: Tadoba tiger‚Äôs conduct, health meet NTCA protocol for rehabilitation in natural habitat
content: The tiger didn‚Äôt attack any humans or suffer any injury during its 650-km walk in various landscapes,¬†criteria for a tranquilised tiger‚Äôs release into a suitable habitat with an adequate prey base

title: Amaravati will be among world‚Äôs top quantum hubs, says Lokesh
content: Amaravati Quantum Valley will create large-scale, high-quality, and future-ready jobs for the youth, asserts the IT Minister

title: Kerala rights panel seeks report on mahout killed by jumbo at elephant rehabilitation centre in Kottoor
content: Panel seeks to know whether any preventive measures have been taken to ensure such an incident does not recur

title: Cochin Cancer Research Centre to be inaugurated on February 9
content: Located within the Kalamassery Medical College campus, the CCRC will provide advanced, high-quality cancer care, marking a significant milestone in Kerala‚Äôs efforts to establish the best of cancer treatment and research in the State

title: Three declared foreigners in Assam ordered to leave India
content: The Karbi Anglong district authorities instructed them to exit via Dhubri, Sribhumi or South Salmara-Mankachar districts, bordering Bangladesh

title: Resonance Educational Institutions launches new campus in Kurnool
content: IIT JEE and NEET coaching major expands footprint in Rayalaseema with schools and colleges offering CBSE and integrated programmes

content: BJP president highlights higher tax share, doubled grants and infrastructure push while addressing Budget discussion in Thrissur. Benefits for agricultural sectors such as cashew and cocoa would reach Kerala, he says.

title: Manmohan Singh govt.‚Äôs plan to relocate Dal Lake dwellers shelved; families to stay on the lake
content: The plan to relocate about 9,000 families achieved ‚Äúonly 27%¬†progress‚Äù in 17 years, the J&K government tells Assembly; only 1,808 families were resettled, say officials

title: Ten years of BRS loot will be etched in State‚Äôs annals: CM Revanth Reddy
content: He recalled that former IPS officer R.S. Praveen Kumar had himself spoken about a fake currency case involving KCR

title: Scheyer: Staff got 'punched' in UNC's court storm
content: Duke coach Jon Scheyer said he had staff members "that got punched in the face" as North Carolina fans stormed the court to celebrate a late winning shot in the famed rivalry Saturday night.

title: Sengun sorry for sexist remark at female official
content: Rockets center Alperen Sengun expressed remorse for calling a female referee a 'b----' earlier this week and said he apologized to her after the game.

title: Embattled Fears draws Illini's ire, shines in OT win
content: Jeremy Fears capped a tumultous week by scoring a game-high 26 points to lead Michigan State to an 85-82 overtime win over Illinois, but his play was called into question again when the Illini accused him of intentionally tripping one of their players.

title: Harden nets 23, delivers winning debut for Cavs
content: James Harden combined with Donovan Mitchell for 58 points in his first game with the Cavaliers, who beat the Kings 132-126.

title: Lakers look to model team after champion Dodgers
content: The Lakers are working with the Dodgers in the hopes of modeling the team's practices and structure after the back-to-back World Series champions.

title: Jokic passes Robertson for 2nd in triple-doubles
content: Nikola Jokic passed Oscar Robertson for the second-most triple-doubles in NBA history with 182 in Saturday's win over the Bulls.

title: Falcons rookie Pearce arrested on battery charges
content: Falcons linebacker James Pearce Jr., who finished third in Defensive Rookie of the Year voting, was arrested after police said he fled a domestic dispute and crashed his vehicle during a police chase.

content: The WNBA's latest CBA proposal includes for the first time some concessions on housing but does not have significant updates to revenue sharing, sources told ESPN on Saturday.

title: China carried out covert nuclear test days after Galwan clash in June 2020: US
content: The US has accused China of a covert nuclear test on June 22, 2020, shortly after the deadly Galwan Valley clash. This allegation, coupled with the expiry of the New START treaty, highlights the urgent need for a new global arms control framework.

title: 'Pak firm hired Gogoi‚Äôs wife, salary paid by Ali Sheikh': Himanta
content: Assam cabinet decided to refer the case of Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi's alleged Pakistan connections to the ministry of home affairs, citing national security concerns. Chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma stated that a Pakistan-based firm employed Gogoi's wife, with salary allegedly paid by a Pakistani national, necessitating central agency intervention.

title: ‚Äò35 minutes of horror‚Äô: Kerala spa gang-rape survivor says knife was held to her neck
content: A Thiruvalla spa survivor detailed a brutal gang rape by 10 individuals, stating she was threatened with a knife and suspected one attacker was drugged. Police are investigating a possible 'quotation' motive, with the spa owner alleging a rival spa owner and a police-gangster alliance are behind the attack.

title: T20 World Cup: Pakistan seeks dialogue with ICC over boycott call
content: The ICC and PCB have resumed discussions regarding Pakistan's potential boycott of their T20 World Cup match against India. The PCB invoked 'force majeure' after the Pakistan government instructed them not to play, citing solidarity with Bangladesh. The ICC has warned of significant financial repercussions for the PCB if the boycott proceeds.

title: Video: Moment ‚Äòtsunami ride‚Äô collapsed at Surajkund Mela; cop dead, 13 injured
content: A police inspector died and 13 were injured when an electrical swing collapsed at the Surajkund International Crafts Fair. The ride, carrying 26 people, came unhinged mid-operation. A stall owner rescued several riders before the swing fully collapsed, trapping the inspector. Investigations into mechanical or electrical failure are underway.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
content: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts, an immediate Q&A session, and assurances of safety for all employees, particularly those in vulnerable roles.

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
content: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.

title: Ex-owner of Multani Bakery jumps from 17th floor, dies
content: Former owner of Solapur's renowned Multani Bakery, Sunil Motilal Sadarangani, died by suicide by jumping from a 17th-floor apartment building. Police suspect psychological issues and debt contributed to his actions. Sadarangani had sold his bakery and relocated to Pune, with his family confirming his struggles.

title: ‚ÄòHeadlight was still on‚Äô: How a pit dug hours before tragedy became death trap for Delhi biker
content: A 25-year-old biker tragically died after plunging into a 14-foot-deep pit in Janakpuri, Delhi. Despite being alerted, the sub-contractor who excavated the site allegedly walked away without calling for help. The victim remained undiscovered for over six hours before police were finally notified.

title: Nasa astronauts allowed to bring their iPhones to Space
content: NASA astronauts are now equipped with the latest iPhones for upcoming lunar and ISS missions, replacing older cameras. This move, spearheaded by NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman, aims to streamline the agency's lengthy hardware approval process.  The decision allows crews to capture and share high-quality images and videos, marking a significant upgrade for space exploration documentation.

title: Ofcom revokes TV licences of Overseas Friends of BJP (UK) president
content: UK's Ofcom has revoked broadcasting licences for MATV National and MATV Music, held by Middlesex Broadcasting Corporation Limited. The regulator determined that MATV Broadcasting Ltd, where Kuldeep Shekhawat is a director, exercised editorial control, not the licence holder. Ofcom cited Shekhawat's role as president of Overseas Friends of BJP (UK) as a potential disqualification due to political affiliations.

title: ‚ÄòNo compromise‚Äô: PM Modi reiterates India‚Äôs firm stand on terrorism in Malaysia
content: India and Malaysia are set to bolster security cooperation, including counter-terrorism and intelligence sharing, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced in Kuala Lumpur. He emphasized India's unwavering stance against terrorism, stating there will be "no double standards and no compromise.

title: Frustrated over her 'faulty' e-rickshaw, woman sets it on fire
content: A Shivpuri woman, frustrated by a faulty e-rickshaw and lack of after-sales support, set her vehicle ablaze outside the dealership. The labourer couple, who bought the vehicle for income, claimed it malfunctioned within two months and the agency refused repairs. They demand a fix, replacement, or refund. The agency disputes the claims, citing a battery explosion.

title: 70 students fall ill after consuming mid-day meal at govt school in Bihar
content: Seventy students fell ill after consuming mid-day meals at a school in Madhepura, with one girl in serious condition. Vomiting and stomach pain prompted a rush to the hospital. Local suspicion points to a lizard in the food. An inquiry into the NGO-supplied meal has commenced, promising strict action against those responsible.

title: Bengaluru shocker: 20-year-old Manipur woman crushed to death by BMTC electric bus
content: A 20-year-old beautician from Manipur was tragically killed when a BMTC electric bus rear-ended her scooter near KR Pura railway station. The bus's front wheel ran over her after she was thrown from the vehicle. The BMTC bus driver has been arrested and charged with causing death by negligence and rash driving.

title: Speeding Audi runs over family distributing wedding cards in MP; 3 dead
content: A speeding Audi collided with a motorcycle in Rewa, Madhya Pradesh, killing three people, including a father and his son. The victims were distributing wedding invitations when the tragic accident occurred near Kosta village. The car's driver has been taken into custody as investigations continue.

title: Days after 32-hour ordeal, Mumbai-Pune Expressway clogged yet again
content: Mumbai-Pune expressway faced another weekend traffic nightmare with heavy vehicles causing significant delays. This follows a recent 32-hour snarl from a tanker accident. Officials cite election-related travel and the resumption of stalled truck movement for the persistent gridlock, turning peak hours into a frustrating crawl for thousands.

title: Future of a giant golden Trump statue remains uncertain despite completion; here's why
content: A colossal gold-leafed statue of Donald Trump, "Don Colossus," remains uninstalled in Ohio over a year after completion. Commissioned by crypto entrepreneurs for $360,000, sculptor Alan Cottrill claims he's still owed $92,000. The project highlights crypto venture instability and shifting alliances, with the statue potentially finding a home at Trump's Doral resort.

title: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively friendship strained amid new projects?
content: It seems Taylor Swift and Blake Lively‚Äôs already strained friendship has taken a turn after the popular actress' recent move on social media sparked panic among fans. While Taylor Swift is dealing with a lot of emotions about Blake Lively, Travis Kelce might also be affected by the legal chaos. Neither of these stars have issued any statements in public about the drama.

title: Delhi biker death case: Contractor who‚Äôd dug pit came, saw and left as victim lay there for hours
content: A 25-year-old biker died after falling into a 14-foot pit in Janakpuri. The sub-contractor who dug the pit was arrested after he allegedly saw the victim and left without calling for help. The pit was dug just hours before the accident, with no warning signs or barricades.

title: Suryakumar Yadav walks away from toss to hug Rohit Sharma - Watch
content: Suryakumar Yadav's heartwarming gesture towards Rohit Sharma preceded his match-winning 84, rescuing India from a collapse against the USA.  A disciplined bowling performance, led by Siraj, secured a 29-run victory in their T20 World Cup opener.

title: The $23 million foot: Lost Michelangelo sketch sets auction record
content: A previously unknown Michelangelo foot sketch, identified as a study for the Libyan Sibyl on the Sistine Chapel ceiling, sold for $23 million at Christie's. The drawing, inherited and passed down through a family for centuries, was authenticated through infrared analysis and stylistic comparisons.

title: Burqa-clad man caught in ladies compartment on Mumbai local, video viral
content: A man disguised in a burqa was discovered traveling in a ladies' compartment on a Central Railway local train, sparking outrage among passengers.  The incident, captured on video, led to an FIR being filed by the RPF. The accused managed to escape before being apprehended, and a search is ongoing.

title: 'Drew Nazi symbol with their blood': Chilling details emerge as four Indian students stabbed in Russia
content: A 15-year-old, allegedly linked to a banned neo-Nazi group, stabbed at least six people, including four Indian students, at a Russian university dormitory. The attacker reportedly shouted Holocaust-related slogans and drew a Nazi symbol with victims' blood. He also injured two police officers and himself before being apprehended.

title: Ottneil Baartman: South Africa‚Äôs best death bowler, watching the T20 World Cup from home
content: Keshav Maharaj called Ottneil Baartman the 'best death bowler in the country.' Legendary Dale Steyn, who has coached him for three years, has sung his praises. On the field, he took 20 wickets in the recent SA20 season, including a five-wicket haul. Yet, the seamer has not traveled to India for the T20 World Cup.

title: 'Wife hunt': Norway's crown princess faces backlash over Epstein link; issues apology
content: Norway's Crown Princess Mette-Marit faces backlash over past contact with Jeffrey Epstein, issuing a "profound apology" after emails revealed intimate exchanges and a stay at his home.  Meanwhile, her son, Marius Borg H√∏iby, is on trial denying rape charges, with the Crown Prince emphasizing his private citizen status.

title: B'desh Hindu leader Ramesh Chandra Sen dies in jail, raising custodial treatment concerns
content: Ramesh Chandra Sen, a senior Hindu leader of Bangladesh Awami League, died in Dinajpur District Jail. This incident raised concerns about the treatment of political prisoners.  His passing comes at a sensitive political juncture for Bangladesh as it's about face its first poll since sheikh Hasina' ouster on Feb 12.

title: Trade deal: US whiskey, wine unlikely to give headache to Indian companies
content: Duty concessions on American whiskey and wine are unlikely to significantly impact Indian companies due to minimum import prices and low existing volumes. American whiskey holds less than 0.1% of the Indian market, with distinct flavors appealing to a niche segment. Similarly, imported wines face distribution challenges, with Australian wines leading the small segment.

title: GCC Unified Visa 2026: Guide for single entry to 6 Gulf countries
content: The GCC is launching a unified tourist visa, allowing entry to all six member states with a single online application. Travellers can expect a streamlined digital process, requiring essential documents like a valid passport, itinerary and proof of funds. This initiative aims to simplify multi-country travel across Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain and Oman.

title: 'Abhi bohot dur tak hai jaana': Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's humble words after conquering the world
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's extraordinary 175 off 80 balls powered India to a record-extending sixth ICC Under-19 World Cup title, crushing England by 100 runs. His stellar performance, featuring 15 fours and 15 sixes, overshadowed England's Caleb Falconer's century. Sooryavanshi expressed gratitude and acknowledged the journey ahead.

title: Ahead of Macron‚Äôs visit, DAC likely to meet next week to approve deal for 114 Rafales
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council is set to consider a major proposal to purchase 114 Rafale fighter jets from France for approximately Rs 3.25 lakh crore. This significant procurement, with a substantial portion to be manufactured in India, aims to bolster the Indian Air Force's fighter squadron strength amidst rising regional security concerns.

title: Amitabh Bachchan reacts to ‚Äòthird-rate‚Äô actor remark by journalist
content: Amitabh Bachchan celebrated India's U19 Cricket World Cup victory, reflecting on the nation's elevated global standing. He recalled a past experience where he was labeled a "third-rate actor from a third-world country," a comment that deeply hurt him. Bachchan asserted that India is no longer a third-world nation but a first-world one, evidenced by its numerous world championships.

title: PM Modi, Malaysia PM Anwar Ibrahim hold talks on defence, economy and ASEAN - top developments
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a ceremonial welcome in Malaysia, marking a key moment in his two-day official visit. Bilateral talks with Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim are focusing on defence, economic cooperation, and innovation, aiming to further strengthen their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.

title: 'Should've sent Pak home': Netherlands left distraught after defeat in tense match
content: The Netherlands felt they lost their T20 World Cup opener against Pakistan due to poor execution in the final overs, not Pakistan outplaying them. A dropped catch and missed opportunities allowed Faheem Ashraf to change the game, securing a Pakistan victory. Despite the disappointment, the team remains proud of their fight and looks to their next match.

title: The $500 billion question: What will India import from US?
content: India aims to import $500 billion in US goods over five years, but success hinges on American suppliers meeting demand.  While oil and coal imports are set to rise, high-tech items like chips and aircraft face supply chain challenges.  Indian buyers and US sellers must collaborate to achieve this ambitious trade target.

title: Bengaluru Bodybuilder Dies By Suicide After Girlfriend's Engagement
content: A 26-year-old bodybuilder in Bengaluru allegedly died by suicide after his girlfriend informed him that her marriage was fixed with another man.

title: Drunk Bengaluru Women Crash Into Cab, Hit Driver With Helmet, Abuse Crowd
content: While it is common to hear about drunk men causing trouble on the streets, two drunk women in Bengaluru created chaos on Saturday night.

title: Pakistan Peels Off Bholari Hangar Roof Where Indian Air Force Destroyed Early Warning Aircraft
content: Pakistan Air Force (PAF) appears to be in the early phases of reconstructing or repairing the extensive damage to a hangar at its Bholari airbase.

title: "Dalai Lama Never Met Epstein": Tibetan Spiritual Leader's Office Rejects Reports
content: The office of the Dalai Lama on Sunday firmly denied media reports suggesting any association between the Tibetan spiritual leader and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Police Medal Awardee, Was To Retire In March: Cop Who Died At Surajkund Fair
content: As an amusement ride started tilting at Faridabad's Surajkund fair on Saturday, later crashing down, police officer Jagdish Prasad rushed to the spot to evacuate panicked people on the 'tsunami' swing. He later died of a head injury.

title: Trump Plans First Meeting Of Gaza Board Of Peace On February 19
content: President Donald Trump plans to convene the first meeting of his Board of Peace this month in Washington to raise money for the reconstruction of Gaza.

title: Inside Jeffrey Epstein's 'Baby Ranch': Sex Offender Planned 'Super Race' Of Humans
content: Jeffrey Epstein, the wealthy financier, died in a New York jail cell in 2019 while awaiting trial on federal sex-trafficking charges.

title: Who Are Bangladesh's Top Student Leaders Who Overthrew Sheikh Hasina
content: Bangladesh General Election 2026: Over a year-and-a-half ago, Bangladeshi students took to the streets over job quotas in the public sector. What began as campus protests quickly spread across the country and turned into a movement

title: Video: The Horrific Moment 'Tsunami' Ride Snapped Mid-Air At Surajkund Mela
content: A video from the Surajkund Fair in Faridabad shows the Tsunami swing moments before it broke mid-air and fell to the ground on Saturday evening.

title: Speeding Audi Runs Over Family Distributing Wedding Cards On Bike, 3 Killed
content: Three members of a family were killed after a speeding Audi car hit their motorcycle from behind in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district last evening.

title: 2 Dead, Several Injured As Under-Construction Building Collapses In Rajasthan's Kota
content: The deaths in the building collapse in Rajasthan's Kota rose to two, while at least 13 people were reported injured, officials said.

title: Nazi Slogans, 'Blood' Swastika: How Russia University Attack Unfolded
content: During a frenzied attack in a medical university's dormitory that housed foreign students in Russia, the 15-year-old attacker shouted nationalist slogans about the Holocaust, a local news media report claimed.

title: "We Will Pay, Return Our Mother":  US News Anchor Appeals To Kidnappers
content: Savannah Guthrie told the potential kidnappers of her mother Nancy Guthrie on Saturday that the family is prepared to pay for her safe return, as the frantic search for the 84-year-old Arizona resident has entered a seventh day.

title: 8-Point Safety Framework Issued After Delhi Biker's Death In Janakpuri
content: The Chief Minister flagged serious lapses in safety arrangements at excavation sites and warned that officers and contractors will be held accountable if negligence is found.

title: "Difficult Decisions Taken": Washington Post CEO Resigns After Mass Layoffs
content: Washington Post publisher and CEO Will Lewis is leaving the newspaper, it announced on Saturday after carrying out widespread layoffs this week.

title: India Gains In-Orbit Spying Capability, Can Now Snoop On Enemy Satellites
content: In a significant milestone for India's growing private space sector, Ahmedabad-based Azista Industries Private Limited through its aerospace vertical has demonstrated a new indigenous capability to image objects in orbit from another satellite

title: NDTV Profit Conclave 2026: LCA Tejas Won't Become Dated. Defence Secretary Explains Why
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has placed a large order for 180 Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Tejas. However, some have speculated that by the time the IAF gets all the aircraft it had ordered, these platforms would become dated.

title: Over 70 School Children Fall Ill After Eating Mid-Day Meal In Bihar
content: More than 70 schoolchildren fell ill after consuming the mid-day meal at an Upgraded Middle School in Karu Tola at Sahugarh under Madhepura Sadar block of Bihar on Saturday, triggering panic among teachers, parents and locals.

title: 'Indian Consulate Will Open In Malaysia, Bring Our Nations Closer': PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday announced that an Indian Consulate will also be opened soon in Malaysia, bringing the two nations even closer.

title: Delhi Traffic Police Tests Laser Speed Guns To Boost Enforcement
content: Delhi Traffic Police has intensified speed enforcement measures along the NH-44 corridor by conducting trials of handheld laser speed guns at the Libaspur Bus Stand area, officials said on Saturday.

title: What fantasy basketball managers should do with red-hot Cooper Flagg, Saddiq Bey
content: Cooper Flagg has been the best player in fantasy over the last two weeks . he has averaged 33.4 points, 1.8 3-pointers, 8.8 rebounds, 4.8 assists, 0.8 steals and 1.4 blocks on 53% shooting from the field . the Mavericks are not, getting victories in just three of thei .

title: No Spanish? No problem: Bad Bunny promises a party at halftime
content: Bad Bunny reassures fans they don't have to speak his native language to enjoy the show . "people only have to worry about dance. it's better if they learn to dance," the 31-year-old says . he was greeted by a chorus of fans yelling, "Benito," as he arrived for the pre-Super Bowl event .

title: 2026 NFL Honors: Who won the league's biggest awards?
content: the best of the NFL gathered at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco for Thursday's Super Bowl honors . the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots meet at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California, for super bowl lX . quarterback Matthew Stafford won the biggest prize -- MVP .

title: NHL Awards Watch: Kucherov gaining on MacKinnon for MVP?
content: it's not that Miller won the Vezina Trophy in the same season he backstopped Team USA to an overtime loss in the gold medal round at the Vancouver Games . a great goal from Nathan MacKinnon puts the Avalanche up 2-0 over the Red Wings .

title: When three words can shatter a life: How triple talaq robs women of their 'haq'
content: triple talaq is a brutal power play that shatters lives in seconds . a husband utters three words, and a woman loses her home, income, and future . women bear the full blow when a marriage ends impulsively . "justification" becomes code for suffering silently to avoid scandal .
